p: Hepatocellular carcinoma is one of the widespread malignant diseases, and globally the number of cases has rapidly increased over the past decades. The cytotoxic action of N. sativa seed was exhibited on human hepatoma HepG2 cell lines following 24-hr incubation with different concentrations of the N. sativa extract ( Thabrew et al., 2005). It was found that oral administration of TQ is useful in rising the actions of glutathione transferase and quinine reductase and acts as a potential prophylactic source against toxicity in hepatic cancer and chemical carcinogenesis ( Nagi and Almakki, 2009).
